metadata.title: Making onscreen content available to Siri and Apple Intelligence

abstract.text: Enable Siri and Apple Intelligence to respond to a person’s questions and action requests for your app’s onscreen content.

inlineContent.text: When a user asks a question about onscreen content or wants to perform an action on it, Siri and Apple Intelligence will be able to retrieve the content to respond to the question and perform the action. If the user explicitly requests it, Siri and Apple Intelligence will be able to send content to supported third-party services. For example, someone could view a website and use Siri to provide a summary by saying or typing a phrase like “Hey Siri, what’s this document about?”
Siri’s personal context understanding, onscreen awareness, and in-app actions are in development and will be available with a future software update.

content.text: Create an app entity and associate it with the user activity object

content.text: Make the app entity transferable and conform to an assistant schema

inlineContent.text: Associating an
with the
provides Siri and Apple Intelligence with your app’s onscreen content to offer personalized intelligence assistance.
To go one step further and enable Siri and Apple Intelligence to offer the best response to a person’s request and provide additional functionality, update your app entity code to conform to:
The

protocol, and include image, PDF, rich text, or plain text representations. Provide several representations that best fit your content. For example, an email client might represent an email as rich text, plain text, and a PDF. If you’re new to adopting
, refer to
One of the assistant schemas in the list below. If you’re new to using App Intents and assistant schemas, refer to
By conforming your
to

and an assistant schema, you enable Siri and Apple Intelligence to further process the provided onscreen content and respond to a person’s explicit request to send the content as an attachment to other services, including third parties.

The listed requests below are examples and not exhaustive. Actual functionality depends on factors such as the features provided by Siri and Apple Intelligence, the functionality offered by third-party services, or the phrase a person uses.
Domain
Schema
Swift macro
Example request
Browser
A person might ask Siri questions about the web page.
Document reader
A person might ask Siri to explain the conclusion of a document.
File management
A person might ask Siri to summarize file content.
Mail
A person might ask Siri to provide a summary.
Photos
A person might ask Siri about things to do with an object in a photo.
Presentations
A person might ask Siri to suggest a creative title for a presentation.
Spreadsheets
A person might ask Siri to give an overview of the spreadsheet’s data.
Word processor
A person might ask Siri to suggest additional content for a text document.

abstract.text: A type that uniquely identifies a specific instance of an app entity.
An interface for exposing a custom type or app-specific concept to system experiences like Siri and the Shortcuts app.
A representation of the state of your app at a moment in time.
A protocol that describes how a type interacts with transport APIs such as drag and drop or copy and paste.
The identifier of an app entity that you associate with the user activity.
The app entity describes a document.
A protocol that framework types adopt to enable you to provide content to system experiences.
The app entity describes a media asset.
Make your app’s content and actions discoverable with system experiences like Spotlight, widgets, and the Shortcuts app.
The app entity describes a spreadsheet.
The app entity describes an email message.
Add assistant schemas to your app so Siri can complete requests, and integrate your app with Apple Intelligence, Spotlight, and other system experiences.

abstract.text: Make your app’s actions and content available to Siri and Apple Intelligence with assistant schemas.
The app entity describes a presentation.
The app entity describes a file.

doc://com.apple.AppIntents/documentation.title: Integrating actions with Siri and Apple Intelligence

abstract.text: Create app intents, entities, and enumerations that conform to assistant schemas to tap into the enhanced action capabilities of Siri and Apple Intelligence.
